result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa M Bober was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa M Bober is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa M Bober was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 1 day time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa M Bober

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Melissa M Bober in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Melissa M Bober in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to COUNT 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  AS to COUNT 2: court orders count dismissed.
Sentencing proceeded.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
COUNT 1:    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction,  with credit for 1 day time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Defense counsel to advise of appeal rights.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Melissa M Bober in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Melissa M Bober in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested an adjourned Status Conference for reasons placed on the record. Case adjourned to branch 38 for a Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Melissa M Bober in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests a Status Conference date.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shawn B., Jessica M.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Melissa M Bober in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 23 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/15 @ 1:30pm
